transportAdvice: Mexico City has an extensive metro system that covers most major tourist and residential areas, making it a practical and affordable way to get around; buses and minibuses also serve routes throughout the city. Taxis and ride-hailing vehicles are widely available, and many central neighborhoods like Roma, Condesa, and Polanco are walkable, though the city's size and traffic make public transit preferable for longer distances.

weather.description: Cool and dry with clear skies; mornings and evenings can be quite cold, so layers are recommended.
Dry and mild with warm afternoons and cool nights; one of the more pleasant months to visit.
Temperatures begin to rise and conditions remain dry; expect sunny days and comfortable evenings.
Warm and mostly dry, though occasional afternoon showers may signal the approaching rainy season.
The warmest month of the year with increasing afternoon thunderstorms as the rainy season begins.
Rainy season is well underway with frequent afternoon and evening downpours; mornings are often clear.
One of the wettest months; expect heavy afternoon rains daily, though mornings tend to be bright.
Continued heavy rainfall throughout the month; flooding in low-lying areas is possible.
The peak of the rainy season with the highest monthly rainfall totals; pack a reliable rain jacket.
Rainfall begins to ease toward the end of the month; temperatures are mild and pleasant.
Dry season returns with comfortable temperatures and clear skies; an excellent time to visit.
Cool and dry with festive atmosphere; cold nights require warm clothing but days are generally sunny.
